KH.content: backwards steps (retours en arrière), rhythm of Timaeus, go beyond, under philosophical logos, normal couple, to a third, a bastard, hybrid, orphan (khōra) > necessary but not true
KH.linkedContent: backwards steps (retours en arrière), rhythm of Timaeus, go beyond, under philosophical logos, normal couple, to a third, a bastard, hybrid, orphan (khōra) > necessary but not true

GT.content: Aristotle differentiates tukhē from automaton (chance from human finality), offers example of creditor going to market & getting his debt paid back: pas de don, pas de pardon, everything happens en marchant
GT.linkedContent: Aristotle differentiates tukhē from automaton (chance from human finality), offers example of creditor going to market & getting his debt paid back: pas de don, pas de pardon, everything happens en marchant

H.content: pp. anne 54-6 step beyond border, threshold, because inability to mark a stable territory provokes thought
H.linkedContent: pp. anne 54-6 step beyond border, threshold, because inability to mark a stable territory provokes thought

LOBL.content: all interdictions of pas, its double bind and invagination, make it possible to read the unreadability of impossible event, (the after-life of resurrection) of this “news”
LOBL.linkedContent: all interdictions of pas, its double bind and invagination, make it possible to read the unreadability of impossible event, (the after-life of resurrection) of this “news”

LOBL.content: terribleness of la chose, not only ineffable, unnarratable: it’s interdictory, it forbids telling/seeing
LOBL.linkedContent: terribleness of la chose, not only ineffable, unnarratable: it’s interdictory, it forbids telling/seeing

LOBL.content: interdiction violated by itself, sets in motion a single pas, overflows impossible récit, that which forbids happens [French? arriver?]
LOBL.linkedContent: interdiction violated by itself, sets in motion a single pas, overflows impossible récit, that which forbids happens [French? arriver?]

LOBL.content: performance w/out presence, takes place placelessly, the “-less” or “without,” and the pas, w/out pas, w/out negativity of pas
LOBL.linkedContent: performance w/out presence, takes place placelessly, the “-less” or “without,” and the pas, w/out pas, w/out negativity of pas

LOBL.content: [re: Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort] everything took place as if narrator desired that the 2 women resembled each other > in accordance w/ hymen (pas w/out him)
LOBL.linkedContent: [re: Blanchot’s L’arrêt de mort] everything took place as if narrator desired that the 2 women resembled each other > in accordance w/ hymen (pas w/out him)

AF.content: the archaic impression Freud seeks almost no longer an archive, confuses itself w/ a footstep that leaves its still living mark on surface, place of origin, when step still one w/ subjectile
AF.linkedContent: the archaic impression Freud seeks almost no longer an archive, confuses itself w/ a footstep that leaves its still living mark on surface, place of origin, when step still one w/ subjectile

AF.content: instant when imprint yet to be abandoned by pressure of impression, pure auto-affection, indistinction btwn touching/touched, active/passive, an archive that would confuse itself w/ arkhē ——Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location
AF.linkedContent: instant when imprint yet to be abandoned by pressure of impression, pure auto-affection, indistinction btwn touching/touched, active/passive, an archive that would confuse itself w/ arkhē ——Freud dreams irreplaceable place, the very ash, condition of singularity, idiom, secret, testimony, trace no longer distinguishes itself from substrate > absolutely safe location

AF.content: holds, right on the ash, pressure of Gradiva’s so singular step
AF.linkedContent: holds, right on the ash, pressure of Gradiva’s so singular step

SPOM.content: commodity turns, it changes place, il y a là un pas, its allure belongs to specter/mutant
SPOM.linkedContent: commodity turns, it changes place, il y a là un pas, its allure belongs to specter/mutant

POOF.content: Zarathustra always called us, supposing it teleiopoetically, under neutral, non-dialecticizable law of pas and ‘X w/out X’
POOF.linkedContent: Zarathustra always called us, supposing it teleiopoetically, under neutral, non-dialecticizable law of pas and ‘X w/out X’

HERP.content: for Heidegger, philosophy seeks after, comes later than harmony, this delay eroticizes philosophical search, tension of Eros; Heraclitus & Parmenides not philosophers, no straining, no erotic pas, in accord, Einklang, homology w/ logos
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, philosophy seeks after, comes later than harmony, this delay eroticizes philosophical search, tension of Eros; Heraclitus & Parmenides not philosophers, no straining, no erotic pas, in accord, Einklang, homology w/ logos

HASD.linkedContent: [re: Heidegger’s “if I had to write theology”] pas d’écriture, cette passe ou cette esquive: quasi-transcendental recourse of writing, abyss of denial

A.content: pas [belongs to French?] involves the line that terminates all determination, peras (end, limit) not telos, puts us on path beyond, on other side, peraō eis khoran (penetrate into place, country)
A.linkedContent: pas [belongs to French?] involves the line that terminates all determination, peras (end, limit) not telos, puts us on path beyond, on other side, peraō eis khoran (penetrate into place, country)

A.linkedContent: “coming to pass” of event doesn’t have the movement of passing, traversing, or transiting, a coming without pas, impossible passage, prohibited passage, indeed nonpassage

A.content: aporia: not even the non-pas but the deprivation of pas (a-pas)
A.linkedContent: aporia: not even the non-pas but the deprivation of pas (a-pas)

A.content: in crossing a border, one changes/exchanges death (on change le mort, on change de mort), one passes from figure of death as trespass (passage of line, transgression of border, pas au-delà) to another figure of border btwn life and death
A.linkedContent: in crossing a border, one changes/exchanges death (on change le mort, on change de mort), one passes from figure of death as trespass (passage of line, transgression of border, pas au-delà) to another figure of border btwn life and death

A.content: non-access to death where access is only to the threshold, pas, approach to border
A.linkedContent: non-access to death where access is only to the threshold, pas, approach to border

PAS.content: la démarche d’un pas: the dis(approach) of a no/pace
PAS.linkedContent: la démarche d’un pas: the dis(approach) of a no/pace

PAS.content: pas, like “Viens,” nothing dialectical, not divided by negation or denegation of self, because never present to itself, close to itself: pas de réappropriation [see p. (47)]
PAS.linkedContent: pas, like “Viens,” nothing dialectical, not divided by negation or denegation of self, because never present to itself, close to itself: pas de réappropriation [see p. (47)]

PAS.content: forgetting is another name for pas, affecting without return the being of “is”
PAS.linkedContent: forgetting is another name for pas, affecting without return the being of “is”

PAS.content: pas does not find itself in (dans) a labyrinth [topos], it carries itself along like a labyrinth, has the structure of a labyrinth
PAS.linkedContent: pas does not find itself in (dans) a labyrinth [topos], it carries itself along like a labyrinth, has the structure of a labyrinth

PAS.content: Blanchot’s strange rhythm of near and fear, of pas, ce démarche, imprints itself on (à) our discourse, chooses words
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot’s strange rhythm of near and fear, of pas, ce démarche, imprints itself on (à) our discourse, chooses words

PAS.content: double pas never arresting itself in dialectical negativity of its proceeding nor in the march of a method, the trope of standing-upright [see p. 48]
PAS.linkedContent: double pas never arresting itself in dialectical negativity of its proceeding nor in the march of a method, the trope of standing-upright [see p. 48]

PAS.content: pas-à-pas is a metaphor for de-distancing; pas is immediately singularly multiple
PAS.linkedContent: pas-à-pas is a metaphor for de-distancing; pas is immediately singularly multiple

PAS.content: eau, element where she no longer can find a foothold, also element of “sovereign time,” illusion du sans-pas, of the absence of space, when ses pas have left her, her movement is always entry, penetration [see HYMEN]
PAS.linkedContent: eau, element where she no longer can find a foothold, also element of “sovereign time,” illusion du sans-pas, of the absence of space, when ses pas have left her, her movement is always entry, penetration [see HYMEN]

PAS.content: [summary of adverbial and substantive reversals in phrase: pas au-delà] adverb pas easily becomes name
PAS.linkedContent: [summary of adverbial and substantive reversals in phrase: pas au-delà] adverb pas easily becomes name

PAS.content: pas as annulment and preservation of beyond, not a negation of negation, not an interiorization (negation of negation is an effect of pas, a pas)
PAS.linkedContent: pas as annulment and preservation of beyond, not a negation of negation, not an interiorization (negation of negation is an effect of pas, a pas)

PAS.content: each pas transgresses the pas [contamination of adverb/noun]; violence of this dislocation, sur une scène tout autre, occurs, increases, when it appears not to displace anything in discursivity, consciousness, in unscathed, assured normality of language [alters subterraneanly]
PAS.linkedContent: each pas transgresses the pas [contamination of adverb/noun]; violence of this dislocation, sur une scène tout autre, occurs, increases, when it appears not to displace anything in discursivity, consciousness, in unscathed, assured normality of language [alters subterraneanly]

PAS.linkedContent: faux-pas (faut pas) scrambles (brouiller) syntax and semantics, prediscursive graphemes, “pa”

PAS.content: phrase pas-au-delà accumulates indirection of language too quickly, so it marks the excess
PAS.linkedContent: phrase pas-au-delà accumulates indirection of language too quickly, so it marks the excess

PAS.content: when one gives up rendering account (on s’interdit de rendre compte) of the multiple meanings of pas, one gives up that which takes logic, dialectics, sense toward a coming of the event
PAS.linkedContent: when one gives up rendering account (on s’interdit de rendre compte) of the multiple meanings of pas, one gives up that which takes logic, dialectics, sense toward a coming of the event

PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: passivity is never passive enough, must talk about infinite passivity, beyond all formulations [passivité, passion, passé, pas]

PAS.content: two pas’ do not touch in the same (must not, need not, that’s how it works et que ça saute); that’s how marks are left (by Blanchot); marking time, pas marks pas
PAS.linkedContent: two pas’ do not touch in the same (must not, need not, that’s how it works et que ça saute); that’s how marks are left (by Blanchot); marking time, pas marks pas

PAS.content: le pas de plus, the other pas, haunts or parasitizes, a transgressive passivity, not activity nor labor
PAS.linkedContent: le pas de plus, the other pas, haunts or parasitizes, a transgressive passivity, not activity nor labor

PAS.content: Blanchot: passage, a thickness w/ its own laws and requirements
PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: passage, a thickness w/ its own laws and requirements

PAS.content: “le pas sans pas ne s’arrête pas à une simple pensée de limen”
PAS.linkedContent: “le pas sans pas ne s’arrête pas à une simple pensée de limen”

PAS.content: toujours deux pas, selon le retour éternel de la transgression passive et de l’affirmation répétée (l’affirmation sauvage), double instantaneous interminable preterition, une limite singulière entre la garde et la perte, entre le souvenir aussi et l’oubli > EROS, simulacre de cercle [ring vs. circle]
PAS.linkedContent: toujours deux pas, selon le retour éternel de la transgression passive et de l’affirmation répétée (l’affirmation sauvage), double instantaneous interminable preterition, une limite singulière entre la garde et la perte, entre le souvenir aussi et l’oubli > EROS, simulacre de cercle [ring vs. circle]

PAS.content: [compare description of pas here (not a word, a cry?) to glas]
PAS.linkedContent: [compare description of pas here (not a word, a cry?) to glas]

PAS.content: every revolution needs to take account of Blanchot’s forgetting, forgetting w/out forgetting, a forgetting beyond the protection of repression, a forgetting that describes the whole history of dissimulation > pas d’autre
PAS.linkedContent: every revolution needs to take account of Blanchot’s forgetting, forgetting w/out forgetting, a forgetting beyond the protection of repression, a forgetting that describes the whole history of dissimulation > pas d’autre

PAS.content: “terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept
PAS.linkedContent: “terrifyingly ancient” time, absolute crypt, requires the récit (reciting, it can be a matter of nothing but that), ce récit [of viens], neither relation to the event nor event itself > pas d’événement, pas de concept

PAS.content: double pas, before, beyond all time, resounds in viens, stairway scene, un pas de marche, w/out figure that disappears in it, w/out representation, w/out truth, w/out visibility
PAS.linkedContent: double pas, before, beyond all time, resounds in viens, stairway scene, un pas de marche, w/out figure that disappears in it, w/out representation, w/out truth, w/out visibility

PAS.content: pas deranges order of time and discourse it is a part of [like deconstruction?]
PAS.linkedContent: pas deranges order of time and discourse it is a part of [like deconstruction?]

PAS.content: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack
PAS.linkedContent: double pas, its absolute heterogeneity, deprives of nothing save its identity to self, which prevents distancing from self > double pas, absolute rarefaction w/out the least lack

PAS.content: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas
PAS.linkedContent: if being is another name for forgetting, places forgetting in a crypt, forgets forgetting, in naming forgetting one makes it disappear under its name [(un)names], vs. pas sous le nom d’oubli > le reste sans reste de cet effacement qui ne s’efface plus, voilà ce qu’il y a peut-être, par chance, mais qui n’est pas ou qui est pas

S.content: silent play of quotation marks [re: spirit], Anführungsstriche, Anführungszeichen, “the hand calculates very fast,” Anführen, to conduct, dupe, brainwash, silent contrivances, fort/da, what shows or hides changes everything, and when one puts away after exhibiting, this is mise au pas (bringing to heel)
S.linkedContent: silent play of quotation marks [re: spirit], Anführungsstriche, Anführungszeichen, “the hand calculates very fast,” Anführen, to conduct, dupe, brainwash, silent contrivances, fort/da, what shows or hides changes everything, and when one puts away after exhibiting, this is mise au pas (bringing to heel)

SH.content: untranslatability connected w/ difficult passage (no pasarán), aporia, that isolates one poetic language from another (& multiplicity w/in language) > also ce pas impossible
SH.linkedContent: untranslatability connected w/ difficult passage (no pasarán), aporia, that isolates one poetic language from another (& multiplicity w/in language) > also ce pas impossible

DS.content: Mallarmé: “all method is a fiction” > point de méthode—still a marching order (marche à suivre) > la dissémination dans le repli de l’hymen, pas de méthode pour elle > [no circle-path to first step]
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé: “all method is a fiction” > point de méthode—still a marching order (marche à suivre) > la dissémination dans le repli de l’hymen, pas de méthode pour elle > [no circle-path to first step]

P.content: in Hegel & Heidegger, an “it is necessary (il faut)” re: hermeneutic circle of art > must start w/ work of art, but how can you recognize it as art if you don’t already know what art is?: not a vicious circle, but an engagement of thought, circular feast, experience of limit, closure, resistance, humility > pas de cercle: le désir par cette répétition fidèle du cercle, d’accéder à l’encore infranchi, le désir d’un nouveau pas > lien sans liens, franchir le cercle sans s’affranchir de sa loi, pas sans pas
P.linkedContent: in Hegel & Heidegger, an “it is necessary (il faut)” re: hermeneutic circle of art > must start w/ work of art, but how can you recognize it as art if you don’t already know what art is?: not a vicious circle, but an engagement of thought, circular feast, experience of limit, closure, resistance, humility > pas de cercle: le désir par cette répétition fidèle du cercle, d’accéder à l’encore infranchi, le désir d’un nouveau pas > lien sans liens, franchir le cercle sans s’affranchir de sa loi, pas sans pas

P.content: for Kant & Hegel, pas crossing line finite/infinite interrupts symbolic beauty > Judaism as historical figure of sublime irruption: ban on representation (Kant), Hebraic poetry (Hegel)
P.linkedContent: for Kant & Hegel, pas crossing line finite/infinite interrupts symbolic beauty > Judaism as historical figure of sublime irruption: ban on representation (Kant), Hebraic poetry (Hegel)

SP.content: on following Nietzsche outside speculum, the hermeneutic circle > immeasurable, save for the the steps of a dove (qu’au pas de colombe) [these are the steps of the Übermensch]
SP.linkedContent: on following Nietzsche outside speculum, the hermeneutic circle > immeasurable, save for the the steps of a dove (qu’au pas de colombe) [these are the steps of the Übermensch]

OTO.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s “I am a Doppelgänger”: a contradiction of “double” beyond negativity of dialectical opposition, Blanchot’s Pas au-delà, a single pas, beyond opposition life/death

OTO.linkedContent: autobiography’s signature written in step not beyond, Nietzsche’s one foot beyond life: differance, allo-, thanatography of autobiography

O.content: in thus remaining [outside of oppositions, i.e. sensible/intelligible], does a preface exist? son espacement (préface à une relecture) s’écarte au lieu de la khōra > remarkable limen of the text: what can be read of dissemination > limen: mark, march, margin, mise en marche: citation

TB.content: sacred text is transferability making its translation untranslatable
sacred text (absolute text): pas de sens (not poverty of meaning, but no meaning that would be itself) > sacred text surrenders itself to translation; commands right away the translation it refuses
TB.linkedContent: sacred text (absolute text): pas de sens (not poverty of meaning, but no meaning that would be itself) > sacred text surrenders itself to translation; commands right away the translation it refuses

Gii.linkedContent: to ask about paths (odoi) of Heidegger, his step (pas) and rhythm, his Hand-werk of writing—questions beyond method (d’outre-méthode)

REST.linkedContent: what revenue, what surplus value is unleashed, what ghost step (pas de revenant) still comes to haunt the shoe’s in their painting truth (the annulment of their use-value, their out-of-service dereliction)? [revenue & revenant]

REST.content: are they (the shoes) haunted by some ghost or la revenance itself
REST.linkedContent: are they (the shoes) haunted by some ghost or la revenance itself

REST.content: bet comes back to a comparing (un pari revient toujours à comparer)
REST.linkedContent: bet comes back to a comparing (un pari revient toujours à comparer)

REST.content: has to be a difference to permit it: but a pair is a fixed difference, fixed bet not a bet?, bet so as not to bet, plus de pari, pas de pari > bet on pair: limit absolute wager (pari)
REST.linkedContent: has to be a difference to permit it: but a pair is a fixed difference, fixed bet not a bet?, bet so as not to bet, plus de pari, pas de pari > bet on pair: limit absolute wager (pari)

REST.content: “to suicide” someone —make him come back (le faire revenir) as a ghost (fantôme) or make him stay (le faire rester) as a ghost, où il est, en somme assez bien enterré, ne disposant plus que de ses pas? > pas de revenant, pas de nom [don’t let the dead bury the dead]

DST.linkedContent: ne pas ne pas: redoubles movement of negation through syntactical formation

DST.linkedContent: neither work of dialectic nor unconscious denegation [neither Hegel nor Freud]

C.content: paradigm as revenge: le mort se venge, “model” is always le revenant rêvé: haunting does not befall it, but takes the first step (la hantise ne lui survient pas, elle donne le premier pas)

BSi.linkedContent: à pas de loup (wolf), à pas de colombe (dove) (silent commands order world); wolf, war (hunting), dove, order, peace > both silent

BSi.linkedContent: [re: its double meaning, pas de loup] pas’ savage, stealthy intrusion, an adverb haunts a noun

BSi.content: the pas of “who knows” and “perhaps” suspends order, authority—not in name of obscurantist propaganda
BSi.linkedContent: the pas of “who knows” and “perhaps” suspends order, authority—not in name of obscurantist propaganda

EU.content: Derrida’s 1st thesis title: The Ideality of the Literary Object > Derrida tells Hyppolite: if I saw where I was going, I wouldn’t take another step
EU.linkedContent: Derrida’s 1st thesis title: The Ideality of the Literary Object > Derrida tells Hyppolite: if I saw where I was going, I wouldn’t take another step

EU.content: Derrida also knows enough about where he’s going to think, w/ terror, things aren’t going so well there, would be better not to go there at all

SPEC.content: logic of au-delà, pas au-delà: overflows logic of position, not a substitute/replacement/opposition to/for position, opening another relation, rapport sans rapport, frees itself at a stroke (coup), neither pas nor coup is indivisible
SPEC.linkedContent: logic of au-delà, pas au-delà: overflows logic of position, not a substitute/replacement/opposition to/for position, opening another relation, rapport sans rapport, frees itself at a stroke (coup), neither pas nor coup is indivisible

SPEC.content: death impels (pousse) the pas d’écriture: but de la vie, but sans but, stratégie sans finalité du vivant > Nietzsche’s no conservation, and life a rare genus of that which is dead

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: Freud’s “speculative” writing] démarche of this writing, advancing w/out advancing, time of a detour, pas de thèse repeats itself: PP will not let anything be done w/out it, except repetition itself

SPEC.content: repetition, reproductivity, works w/out saying anything, like death drive, not even “form,” w/out thesis, de-monstration makes its proof (preuve) sans montrer > de-monstration folds into everything it makes explicit, pas de démonstration remains (reste) in this restance

SPEC.content: detour expanding immeasurably: Umweg of 1st Chapter [re: Freud’s Beyond…] secondary to absolute/unconditional Umweg > pas de détour always leads back to death, not a question of going (aller) but of coming back (revenir)—this is the passage

SPEC.content: [vis-à-vis Freud] pas de plus > deux temps of drive: 1) conserves 2) insures path to death, pas de mort, organism arrives by its own (internal) step at death (eigenen Todesweg): s’envoyer the message of one’s own death
